snippet: The panel appointed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said it had found possible sham nonprofit groups funded with public money and businesses using campaign donations to influence laws.
abstract: Moreland Act Commission panel appointed by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo says it has found possible sham nonprofit groups funded with public money and businesses using campaign donations to influence laws; panel's primary charge is to recommend broad reforms to state's political system, more so than to build cases against individual politicians and businesses.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

lead_paragraph: The panel appointed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said it had found possible sham nonprofit groups funded with public money and businesses using campaign donations to influence laws.

headline.main: Corruption Panel’s Report Offers Look at the Payback Culture in Albany
headline.print_headline: Corruption Panel’s Report Offers Look at the Payback Culture in Albany

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
